antimicrobial.name: Antimicrobial Stewardship
antimicrobial.description: Antimicrobial Stewardship is when an organisation promotes and monitors the correct use of antibiotics to ensure they remain effective in the future. The following measures are useful for monitoring antibiotic prescribing to support antimicrobial stewardship and reduce the threat of antimicrobial resistance.

cardiovascular.name: Cardiovascular system
cardiovascular.description: These measures are for treatments commonly used for treating conditions affecting the cardiovascular system.

centralnervous.name: Central Nervous system
centralnervous.description: These measures are for treatments commonly used for treating conditions affecting the central nervous system.

cost.name: Cost Saving
cost.description: The following measures and an accumulation of all openprescribing.net measures where changes to prescribing in this area will result in cost savings. For more information on how OpenPrescribing can support identification of cost-saving opportunities please consult our How-to guide.

diabetes.name: Diabetes
diabetes.description: These measures are for treatments commonly used for treating diabetes.

efficacy.name: Efficacy
efficacy.description: Available evidence suggests that these treatments may not be effective or have more efficacious alternatives.

erectiledysfunction.name: Erectile Dysfunction
erectiledysfunction.description: These measures are for treatments commonly used for treating erectile dysfunction.

eye.name: Eye
eye.description: These measures are for treatments commonly used for treating conditions affecting the eye.

gastrointestinal.name: Gastrointestinal system
gastrointestinal.description: These measures are for treatments commonly used for treating conditions affecting the gastrointestinal system.

generic.name: Generic prescribing
generic.description: The NHS has a policy of prescribing medicines by their generic name unless there is a clinical reason why the medicine must be prescribed by brand. Generic prescribing has saved the NHS significant amounts of money and is believed to be safer. The following measures identify medicines that should either be prescribed generically, or prescribed by brand for safety reasons.

infections.name: Infections
infections.description: These measures are for treatments commonly used for treating infections, including antibiotics and dressings.

lowpriority.name: NHS England Low Priority
description: This is a list of products
considered a low priority for NHS Funding
by NHS England. For more information on how OpenPrescribing can support identification of cost-saving opportunities please consult our How-to guide.

lowpriorityconsultation.name: NHS England Low Priority (Consultation)
description: This is an experimental list of products

have proposed to add to their Low Priority list. Please note this consultation has now closed. For more information on how OpenPrescribing can support identification of cost-saving opportunities please consult our How-to guide.

mentalhealth.name: Mental Health
mentalhealth.description: These measures are for treatments commonly used for treating mental health conditions.

nutrition.name: Nutrition
nutrition.description: These measures are for treatments commonly used to improve nutrition.

opioids.name: Opioids
opioids.description: Opioids are painkillers and their use has been increasing in England (see paper). Although opioids provide effective analgesia for acute pain and in palliative care, there is little evidence of benefit for long-term opioids in most patients with persistent non-cancer pain, in terms of pain, quality of life or functioning, and they can have serious side-effects. These measures relate to the use of opioids and can be used to openly audit prescribing. More resources for reviewing prescribing are available at the Opioids Aware project.

pain.name: Pain
pain.description: These measures are for treatments commonly used for treating pain.

paper.name: Mentioned in Papers
description: The below measures have been referenced in papers published by the EBM DataLab team.

reproductive.name: Reproductive system
reproductive.description: These measures are for treatments commonly used for treating conditions affecting the reproductive system.

respiratory.name: Respiratory
respiratory.description: These measures are for treatments commonly used for treating respiratory conditions such as asthma and COPD.

safety.name: Safety
safety.description: Improving safety is about reducing risk and minimising mistakes. The World Health Organisation has launched its third patient safety challenge Medication Without Harm. Changes in the following measures may result in reduction of the risk of harm to patients and contribute to WHOs ambition in reducting medication related harm by 50% within 5 years.
